alert.note: Alert for Door (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 10 at 9:45PM CST until February 11 at 6:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW WILL RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS TONIGHT... .A fast moving storm system will sweep across the region tonight. Snow, moderate to heavy at times, will taper off from west to east overnight, ending in eastern Wisconsin by around 2 am. After the more significant snow ends, a mix of light snow, freezing drizzle or drizzle can be anticipated through about daybreak. Lake-effect snow showers will increase across Vilas County later Friday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. Winds gusting to around 35 mph will produce some blowing and drifting of the snow. Light freezing drizzle or drizzle will mix with the snow late tonight into early Friday morning. * WHERE...Door County. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Snow and patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Wisconsin can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
